      • toStringWith

        public java.lang.String toStringWith(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> source)
        Input 'Conllection' type parameter,output 'String' data
         String[] arr1 = { "张三", "李四", "王二", "麻子", "Android", "10086", "@%˜*&ˆ#$",
                "hello world", "怡情" };
 List<String> list = Arrays.asList(arr1);
 System.out.println(resourceTool.toStringWith(list)); 
        Output:
        张三李四王二麻子Android10086@%~*&^#$hello world怡情
        Parameters:
        source - :
        Returns:

      • toStringWith

        public java.lang.String toStringWith(java.lang.String source,
                            java.lang.String format)
        Input 'String' type parameter,Formatted output 'String' data 
         String str1="今天天气真心不错！ Happy!";
 System.out.println(resourceTool.toStringWith(str1,"_"));
        
 Output:今_天_天_气_真_心_不_错_！_H_a_p_p_y_!
        More information,please @see DictTest
        Parameters:
        source -
        format - : Any value and format also can equals null
        Returns:
        String

      • toPinYinWithStringArray

        public java.lang.String[] toPinYinWithStringArray(char c,
                                         ResourceType.OutPutStyle styles,
                                         Utils.PinYinStyles pinYinStyles)
        Given a hanzi to find pinyin.Eg: '张' ：default return zhang ,besides after set ResourceType.OutPutStyle But if c="c" that will return "null".Because 'c' is not hanzi! 
                Support formatted output style and polyphone:
                        '会'：
                                        1.hui 
                                        2.kuai
                        '张'：
                                        1.zhāng
        return String[]
        if it is not a hanzi ,it will return 'null'
        Parameters:
        c - : char type
        styles - : ResourceType.OutPutStyle type
        Returns:
        String[]

      • toPinYinWithString

        public java.lang.String toPinYinWithString(char c,
                                  ResourceType.OutPutStyle styles,
                                  Utils.PinYinStyles pinYinStyles)
        If argument is a hanzi ,it will return an pinyin ;if not will return 'null'
        Note:
        This method not support POLYPHONE,but still support formated output style
        Parameters:
        c -
        styles -
        Returns:
        String

      • toPinYinWithStringArray

        public java.lang.String[] toPinYinWithStringArray(char c,
                                         Utils.PinYinStyles pinYinStyles)
        Given a hanzi to find pinyin.Eg: '张' ： return zhang But if c="c" that will return "null".Because 'c' is not hanzi! 
                Support polyphone:
                        '会'：
                                        1.hui
                                        2.kuai
        return String[]
  if it is not a hanzi please see below code：
  ResourceTool resourceTool = ResourceTool.getInstance();
   resourceTool.toPinYinWithStringArray('a',Utils.PinYinStyles.ONLYCHINEASE)  ==> null 
   resourceTool.toPinYinWithStringArray('a',Utils.PinYinStyles.COMPLETE)  ==> a (itself)
   resourceTool.toPinYinWithStringArray('会',Utils.PinYinStyles.COMPLETE) ==> hui   kuai 
   resourceTool.toPinYinWithStringArray('会',Utils.PinYinStyles.ONLYCHINEASE) ==> hui   kuai
        toPinYinWithStringArray
        Parameters:
        c - : char type
        pinYinStyles - : PinYinStyles
        Returns:
        String[]

      • toPinYinWithString

        public java.lang.String toPinYinWithString(char c,
                                  Utils.PinYinStyles pinYinStyles)
        The same as toPinYinWithStringArray,except return String type not Array. If argument is a hanzi ,it will return an pinyin ;if not will return 'null'
        Note:
        This method not support POLYPHONE and not support formated output style.
        if want to formated output ,please invoke toPinYinWithString(char c, ResourceType.OutPutStyle styles)
        Parameters:
        c -
        Returns:
        String

      • toPinYinWithMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> toPinYinWithMap(java.lang.String c)
        Invoke this method we can get a key-value 
                key : Your Hanzi
        value: PinYin ,Default output style is
 ResourceType.OutPutStyle.NOTHING
        To save duplicate,So the key is consist of hanzi and a serial number; More information,please @see DictTest
        Parameters:
        c -
        Returns:
        Map

      • toPinYinWithMapMixModul

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> toPinYinWithMapMixModul(java.lang.String c)

      • toPinYinWithMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> toPinYinWithMap(java.lang.String c,
                                                                 ResourceType.OutPutStyle style)
        Invoke this method we can get a key-value 
                key : Your Hanzi
        value: PinYin , Output style is
 ResourceType.OutPutStyle
 
 
         To save  duplicate,So the key is consist of hanzi and a serial number;
 More information,please @see DictTest
        Parameters:
        c -
        style -
        Returns:
        A map

      • toPinYinWithMapMixModul

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> toPinYinWithMapMixModul(java.lang.String c,
                                                                         ResourceType.OutPutStyle style)
        The same as toPinYinWithMap except if invoke toPinYinWithMapMixModul it does not filter hanzi Eg: 
                        String c = "hello world 张",Not only output 'zhang',in fact it will output:hello world zhang
        Parameters:
        c -
        style -
        Returns:
        Map
